Articles.Content:
If it still shows maintenance notice for you, the link below works around the problem. You will get a security notice because the certificate is given to kerbalspaceprogram.com, not 85.236.103.6. If you choose to override those, you will reach the store.

[https://85.236.103.6/kspstore/](https://85.236.103.6/kspstore/)
It's back up now (at least for me).

Yeah, thats a no go. It gets me past the sever migration but the page it takes me too is broken, it looks like this:

![Screen%20Shot%202015-04-27%20at%201.57.23%20PM_zpsqhyhtwul.png](http://i1232.photobucket.com/albums/ff366/Aerindel_Prime/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-27%20at%201.57.23%20PM_zpsqhyhtwul.png)

> 
> It's back up now (at least for me).

Good to hear. Wasn't up for me, but DNS changes are like that, some places see the new site while others still see the old. I have heard of cases where specific operators' DNS has taken up to 24 hours to update. Not a smart move to do a DNS update at the same time as a major release, I'd say.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Yeah, thats a no go. It gets me past the sever migration but the page it takes me too is broken, it looks like this:
> [http://i1232.photobucket.com/albums/ff366/Aerindel_Prime/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-27%20at%201.57.23%20PM_zpsqhyhtwul.png](http://i1232.photobucket.com/albums/ff366/Aerindel_Prime/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-27%20at%201.57.23%20PM_zpsqhyhtwul.png)

Looks like a CSS file failed to load. You should still be able to log in with the email and password textboxes even though it looks like the '90s are making a comeback at you.
The password text field is non functional. Can't enter anything in it.
Try another browser. Had same issue just opened a different browser and issue gone.

Yeah, first thing I did. I've actually tried this on four computers and three browers now. Same results. This is killing me. I cleared my day so I could just sit and play Kerbal and I can't even get the website to load.

> 
> Yeah, first thing I did. I've actually tried this on four computers and three browers now. Same results. This is killing me. I cleared my day so I could just sit and play Kerbal and I can't even get the website to load.

You have probably already tried clearing your browser cache too, but I'll throw the idea in just in case...
Yep. I even tried this on a clean install of firefox.
I tried the link provided, and you can get to the password part if you press tab instead of clicking on it.

> 
> Yep. I even tried this on a clean install of firefox.

Sounds like something is really screwing with your connection. Have you checked your firewall software? Do you use a HTTP proxy? Maybe you might try the TOR browser, you don't need the privacy aspect for downloading KSP but it could get you around some ISP shenanigans that can cause trouble.

Edit: Or Yellowburn's advice. I really hope you have luck with that one! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Wow, thanks using Tab worked. I'm in!

BTW, same results on Tor and I even tried it on my Playstation browser and it was the same.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T20:57:58Z" title="04/27/2015 08:57  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by Aerindel**

> 
> Wow, thanks using Tab worked. I'm in!
> BTW, same results on Tor and I even tried it on my Playstation browser and it was the same.

That's... unusual. Rarely does a website get so broken exactly the same way on so many browsers. I'm glad you got in though! Many happy launches!

I know, its one of the most bizarre problems I've ever run into.

I still wonder who had the bright idea to completely screw up the website the night before what is probably the biggest KSP launch ever. If I hadn't come here I would still be staring at "Server Migration"

Pity the masses who have no idea how get around that...

Well, most of the masses probably use steam anyway.

Yeah. Well at leastit finally got me to come to the forum. 

Played with Tor some more and got an identity from the UK and THAT gets me in. Would take forever to download it that way but at least I have proof that for some people the website is working. I may have to look into this "steam" thing I've heard so much about. KSP is the only game I play on my computer so I never really bothered to look into it before.

"It could be carried by an African server!"

"Well yeah, an African server, maybe! But not a European server, that's my point."

"Oh yeah, I agree with that."

"WILL YOU ASK YOUR MASTER IF HE WOULD LET ME DOWNLOAD KERBAL?"

"... but then of course African servers are non-migratory..."

"Oh yeah... so they couldn't bring a Kerbal back anyway..."

Guys, the site DNS address changed and many DNS servers have been slow to update, the only one I know that is working is Googles IPv4 DNS servers at 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4

You'll need to change your DNS server if you are having trouble.
